post.description: Tries to create a new order. Will work if the buyer has enough credit limit and payment terms for the given order. Once successfully created, the total amount of the order will be subtracted from the buyer's available credit limit.

orderDate.description: Order UTC date in ISO 8601 format.

estimatedDeliveryDateUTC.description: Order estimated delivery UTC date in ISO 8601 format.

id.description: Creditpay's internal order ID. UUID v4 format.

dueDate.description: Order due UTC date in ISO 8601 format.

createdAt.description: Order creation UTC date in ISO 8601 format.

fundedAt.description: Asset funded UTC date in ISO 8601 format.

maturityDate.description: Asset maturity UTC date in ISO 8601 format.

issuanceDate.description: Invoice issuance date in ISO 8601 format. Extracted from the NF-e.

fees.description: Fees that were calculated based on the invoice.

faceValueCents.description: Sum of all assets face values

expectedPayoutCents.description: Sum of all assets face values minus the total CrediPay fee

disbursedAmountCents.description: Sum of all assets disbursed amount cents

transactionFeeCents.description: Order transaction fee amount in cents.

discountFeeCents.description: Order discount fee amount in cents.

totalFeeCents.description: Order total fee amount in cents.

chargeBuyerTransactionFee.description: Indicates whether or not the seller has charged the buyer the transaction fee.

chargeBuyerDiscountFee.description: Indicates whether or not the seller has charged the buyer the discount fee.

parameters.description: Credipay's internal order ID. UUID v4 format.

post.description: Moves an accepted order to finalized state. Status for indicating the order is ready to be processed by the seller, following the delivery of the goods or services.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: Credipay's internal order ID. UUID v4 format.

409.description: Could not finalize order. Order could be already finalized OR is not in accepted state.

post.description: Moves an order to cancelled state and increases the buyer's available credit limit by that order's total amount. Cannot be done if an order already has an invoice linked to it.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: Credipay's internal order ID. UUID v4 format.

409.description: Could not cancel order. Order could be already cancelled OR is not in any of the following states [created, accepted, finalized, rejected].

get.description: Lists all assets linked to an application.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status of the assets to filter by.

parameters.name: settledAtFromDate
parameters.description: Filter assets settled after this date. Can be used together with settledAtToDate to query a date-range.

parameters.name: settledAtToDate
parameters.description: Filter assets settled before this date. Can be used together with settledAtFromDate to query a date-range

id.description: Credipay's internal asset ID. UUID v4 format.

settledAt.description: Asset settled UTC date in ISO 8601 format.

invoiceNumber.description: Invoice number. It can be the seller's internal invoice ID.

parameters.name: sellerTaxId
parameters.description: Tax Id of the seller. It is used to filter the seller configurations defined for each buyer. If not provided the seller configurations for all sellers linked to the application are returned.

taxId.description: The tax ID of the company

onboarded.description: Whether or not the buyer has completed the onboarding

eligible.description: Whether or not the buyer is eligible for credit

parameters.name: sellerTaxId
parameters.description: Tax Id of the seller. It is used to filter the seller configurations defined for the buyer. If not provided the seller configurations for all sellers linked to the application are returned.

taxId.description: The tax ID of the company

onboarded.description: Whether or not the buyer has completed the onboarding

eligible.description: Whether or not the buyer is eligible for credit

get.description: Returns the maximum payment term days between seller company and buyer company.

parameters.name: buyerTaxId
parameters.description: The tax id (CNPJ) of the buyer company.

parameters.name: sellerTaxId
parameters.description: The tax id (CNPJ) of the seller company.

post.description: Returns the payment terms between seller company and buyer company together with information of how much fees an order would include depending on the payment terms.

requestBody.description: The taxId of the buyer company.

totalOrderAmountCents.description: Total order amount in cents, excluding fees

chargeBuyerTransactionFee.description: Indicates whether the buyer will pay the transaction fee.

chargeBuyerDiscountFee.description: Indicates whether the buyer will pay the discount fee.

timestamp.description: Payment term timestamp in ISO 8601 format.

totalInvoiceAmountCents.description: Total invoice amount in cents, including fees

paymentTermDays.description: The payment term for which the calculation result applies

get.description: Gets the configuration of a buyer for a seller

timestamp.description: Payment term timestamp in ISO 8601 format.

post.description: Allows you to submit a Nota Fiscal XML file and link it to an order. The XML must match the order data and the same XML cannot be linked to more than one non-canceled order at the same time.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: Credipay's internal order ID. UUID v4 format. If provided the uploaded invoice will be linked to this order.

parameters.name: reconciliate
parameters.description: If provided and set to true, the uploaded invoice will be used for reconciliation.

requestBody.description: Nota Fiscal XML file. Needs to have been processed and approved by SEFAZ (draft XMLs are not allowed).
